title: Origins layer JSON schema by S_K_Tiger
description:
See: https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/json/origin_layer/ if you have any questions.
Found any mistakes? Open a issue at https://github.com/S-K-Tiger/PackdevUtils/issues

order.description: Specifies the order of this layer in the choose and view origin screen among the other layers. Smaller numbers mean it appears before layers with larger numbers.

origins.description:
Defines the origins that should be in this layer.
Identifier strings and Conditioned Origin objects can be mixed in the same array.
IDs of the origins which should become available when the condition is fulfilled.

enabled.description: If set to false, this layer will be unavailable.

replace.description: If set to false, the data in this file will be appended to an already existing version of this layer. Useful to add custom origins to the default origin layer for example. If set to true, the layer will be replaced and only the origins specified in this file will appear.

name.description: The display name of the layer. Will show at the top of the GUI saying "Choose your [name here]". Can be a literal string or a translation key.

gui_title.description: If specified, the choose/view origin title for the layer (the text that shows at the top of the GUI) will be overridden by this.

choose_origin.description: If specified, this will override the title that shows up when choosing an origin in the layer.

view_origin.description: If specified, this will override the title that shows up when viewing an origin in the layer.

missing_name.description: The display name of the origin that will show when viewing the origin if no origin has been assigned to this layer. Can be a literal string or a translation key.

missing_description.description: The description of the origin that will show when viewing the origin if no origin has been assigned to this layer. Can be a literal string or a translation key.

allow_random.description: If set to true, this layer will show an option for choosing a random origin.

allow_random_unchoosable.description: Whether origins which are unchoosable (`unchoosable` field set to true in the origin file) should be included in the random option. Can for example be used to force players to choose a random origin, by setting this to true and making all origins in the layer unchoosable.

exclude_random.description: If specified, the origins included in this list will not be picked by the random choice.

default_origin.description: If set, the origin with this ID will automatically be chosen for a new player. If an orb of origin is used later on, the player will be able to choose another origin then and the `default_origin` will not apply. Could for example be used to make all players start as human, and then use the orb as a progression item to select an origin.

auto_choose.description: If set to true, this layer will automatically pick an origin for the player if only one option is available. This also applies when an orb of origin is used.

hidden.description: If set to true, this layer will be hidden from the "View Origin" screen.

loading_priority.description: Specifies when this layer is loaded. Higher numbers mean it's loaded later, which means it will override those with lower loading priorities which share the same ID.

bientity_condition.description:
Bi-entity Condition Types operate on a Pair<Entity, Entity>, or in simpler terms: an actor and a target. The actor and target is determined depending on the used power type, and can be swapped. These are available to power/condition types that provides a bientity_condition object field.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_condition_types/

type.description:
ID and namespace of the bientity condition to evaluate.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_condition_types/

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description:
All of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/and/

value.description:
If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/constant/

conditions.description:
Any of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/or/

condition.description:
The entity condition type to check for on the acting entity.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_condition_types/actor_condition/

The entity condition type to check on both the actor and target entity.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_condition_types/both/

The entity condition type to check on either actor or target entities.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_condition_types/either/

The bi-entity condition type to check which will have its 'target' and 'actor' contexts swapped.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_condition_types/invert/

The entity condition type to check for on the target entity.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_condition_types/target_condition/

The bi-entity condition type to check for.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_condition_types/undirected/

shape_type.description:
Determines how the ray-cast will handle blocks.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/shape_types/

fluid_handling.description:
Determines how the ray-cast will handle fluids.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/fluid_handling/

comparison.description: How to compare the distance against the specified value.

compare_to.description: The distance (in blocks) to compare the distance between the actor and target to.

items.description: The axes to get the angle values to calculate, and compare to.

actor_rotation.description: Determines the initial point of the rotation for the actor. Accepts "head" or "body".

target_rotation.description: Determines the initial point of the rotation for the target. Accepts "head" or "body".

comparison.description: Determines how the calculated angle value will be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the calculated angle value to.

biome_condition.description:
Biome Conditions operate on a Biome.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/biome_condition_types/

type.description:
ID and namespace of the biome condition to evaluate.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/biome_condition_types/

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description:
All of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/and/

value.description:
If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/constant/

conditions.description:
Any of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/or/

category.description:
Which category the biome must be in order to succeed the check.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/biome_categories/.

precipitation.description: Which precipitation the biome has to have in order to succeed the check. One of none, rain and snow.

comparison.description: How the temperature should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description:
Which value the temperature should be compared to.
See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Biome#List_of_Overworld_climates for a list of temperature values for the vanilla biomes.

block_condition.description:
Block Condition Types operate on CachedBlockPosition, essentially a combination of World and BlockPos, which allows retrieving all necessary information about the block. These are available to power/condition types that provides a block_condition object field.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/block_condition_types/

type.description:
ID and namespace of the block condition to evaluate.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/block_condition_types/

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description:
All of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/and/

value.description:
If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/constant/

conditions.description:
Any of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/or/

condition.description: The condition to check with the given offset.

x.description: How much to offset the position on the x-axis.

y.description: How much to offset the position on the y-axis.

z.description: How much to offset the position on the z-axis.

adjacent_condition.description: The block condition that needs to be fulfilled by adjacent blocks to count towards this condition.

comparison.description: How the number of adjacent blocks which fulfill adjacent_condition should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the number to.

comparison.description: Determines how the blast resistance of the block is compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the blast resistance of the block to.

property.description:
The name of the property that should be checked.
See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Block_states#List_of_block_states for possible values.

comparison.description: If specified, determines how the specified property will be compared to a specified value. If not and the property is an integer, it will just check if the block has the specified property.

compare_to.description: If specified, the value to compare to the value of the specified property.

value.description: If specified, the boolean to compare to the value of the specified property if the specified property is a boolean.

enum.description: If specified, the string to compare to the specified property if the specified property is a string.

block.description: The namespace and ID of the block that this block needs to be to pass the check.

reference.description: The point to compare the distance to. Accepts "world_origin" or "world_spawn".

offset.description: If specified, determines how much the reference point should be offset.

ignore_x.description: Determines whether to consider the X axis to be 0.

ignore_y.description: Determines whether to consider the Y axis to be 0.

ignore_z.description: Determines whether to consider the Z axis to be 0.

shape.description: Determines the shape of the check.Determines the shape of the check. Accepts "cube", "star" or "sphere".

scale_reference_to_dimension.description: Determines whether to check for the reference point whilst considering the coordinate scale of the dimension.

result_on_the_wrong_dimension.description: If specified, this value will override the result of the comparison if the block being tested is not in the reference's dimension.

round_to_digit.description: If specified, rounds the result to the closest number with the specified amount of digits after the comma. Negative numbers also work (e.g: -2 rounds to multiples of 100).

comparison.description: Determines how the calculated distance is compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the calculated distance to.

fluid_condition.description: The fluid condition type to check the fluid state at the position.

comparison.description:
Determines how the hardness value of the block is compared to the specified value.
See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Breaking#Blocks_by_hardness for a list of hardness for vanilla blocks

compare_to.description: The value to compare the hardness value of the block to.

comparison.description: How the Y position of the block should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the Y position of the block to.

tag.description: The namespace and ID of the tag which the block should be in to pass the check.

light_type.description: The type of light level to compare. Either sky or block. If no type is provided, the greater value of the two types will be used, which is the "resulting" light level of that position.

comparison.description: How the light level should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the light level at the block's position to.

material.description: If specified, checks if the block classifies as this material. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/materials/ for possible values.

materials.description: If specified, checks if the block classifies as one of these materials. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/materials/ for possible values.

items.description: If specified, checks if the block classifies as this material. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/materials/ for possible values.

nbt.description: The NBT data to check for.

comparison.description: Determines how the slipperiness value of the block is compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the slipperiness value of the block to.

damage_condition.description:
Damage Condition Types operate on a combination of DamageSource and Float, allowing to check not only the type of damage dealt, but also how much damage was dealt. These are available to power/condition types that provides a damage_condition object field.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/damage_condition_types/

type.description:
ID and namespace of the damage condition to evaluate.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/damage_condition_types/

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description:
All of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/and/

value.description:
If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/constant/

conditions.description:
Any of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/or/

comparison.description: How the amount of damage should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the amount of damage to.

entity_condition.description: If set, the attacking entity must fulfill the provided entity condition in order for this condition to evaluate to true.

name.description: Name the damage source should have to pass the check. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/damage_source_names/ for possible values.

projectile.description: If set, the check will only pass if the projectile was of an entity type with the specified namespace and ID.

entity_condition.description:
Entity Condition Types operate on an Entity, which also allows access to the world. These are available to be used in most powers in the condition object field (or entity_condition in other power/condition types), which restricts when a power is active.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/

type.description:
ID and namespace of the entity condition to evaluate.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description:
All of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/and/

value.description:
If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/constant/

conditions.description:
Any of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/or/

ability.description:
The namespace and ID of the ability to check for.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/player_abilities/ for a list of vanilla Player Abilities

advancement.description: The namespace and ID of the advancement the player needs to have completed in order for this condition to evaluate to true.

comparison.description:
How the breath (in ticks) should be compared to the specified value.
Players (and most mobs) have a max value of 300 ticks, whilst dolphins have a max value of 4800 ticks. Axolotls, on the other hand, have a max value of 6000 ticks.
In order to get the value of a single bubble, you can divide the max value by 10. (max / 10 = value)

compare_to.description: Which value the breath should be compared to.

attribute.description: ID of the attribute of which the value should be checked. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Attribute#Attributes for a list of vanilla attributes that can be checked for.

comparison.description: How to compare the attribute's value to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the attribute's value to.

biome.description: If specified, only evaluate the condition to true if the biome the entity is in matches the specified namespace and ID.

biomes.description: If specified, only evaluate the condition to true if the biome the entity is in matches one of the specified namespace and IDs.

items.description: Only evaluate the condition to true if the biome the entity is in matches the specified namespace and ID.

condition.description: If specified, only evaluate the condition to true if the biome the entity is in fulfills the specified biome condition type.

then.$comment: May not have both "biome" and "biomes" and must include at least on of the properties.

offset_x.description: By how much of the bounding box size should the box be offset in the X direction (e.g.: 0 = no offset, 1 = offset of exact width, 2 = offset of twice the width of the bounding box)

offset_y.description: By how much of the bounding box size should the box be offset in the Y direction (e.g.: 0 = no offset, 1 = offset of exact width, 2 = offset of twice the width of the bounding box)

offset_z.description: By how much of the bounding box size should the box be offset in the Z direction (e.g.: 0 = no offset, 1 = offset of exact width, 2 = offset of twice the width of the bounding box)

block_condition.description: The block condition type to check for.

radius.description: The radius to check the blocks that fulfills the specified block condition type within.

shape.description: Determines the shape of the radius. Accepts "cube", "star" or "sphere".

comparison.description: How the amount of blocks within the specified radius which fulfills the specified block condition type should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the amount to.

comparison.description: How to compare the brightness against the specified value.

compare_to.description:
Which value to compare the brightness against.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/brightness/

command.description:
The command to execute.
origins:command is only effective server-side. That means client-side power types such as origins:climbing, origins:entity_glow, origins:shader, etc. won't work with this.

comparison.description: How to compare the stored result of the specified command to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the stored result of the specified command to.

permission_level.description: [Deprecated since 1.1.0]The permission level to use for the command. 0 is a "survival player", anything higher emulates some form of operator. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Server.properties#op-permission-level for details.

dimension.description: The namespace and ID of the dimension the player needs to be in for this condition to evaluate to true. Vanilla dimensions are minecraft:overworld, minecraft:the_nether and minecraft:the_end, but namespace and IDs of custom/modded dimensions should also work.

reference.description: The point to compare the distance to. Accepts "world_origin" or "world_spawn".

offset.description: If specified, determines how much the reference point should be offset.

ignore_x.description: Determines whether to consider the X axis to be 0.

ignore_y.description: Determines whether to consider the Y axis to be 0.

ignore_z.description: Determines whether to consider the Z axis to be 0.

shape.description: Determines the shape of the check.Determines the shape of the check. Accepts "cube", "star" or "sphere".

scale_reference_to_dimension.description: Determines whether to check for the reference point whilst considering the coordinate scale of the dimension.

result_on_the_wrong_dimension.description: If specified, this value will override the result of the comparison if the block being tested is not in the reference's dimension.

round_to_digit.description: If specified, rounds the result to the closest number with the specified amount of digits after the comma. Negative numbers also work (e.g: -2 rounds to multiples of 100).

comparison.description: Determines how the calculated distance is compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the calculated distance to.

check_state.description: Determines if the condition should check if the entity is currently flying with an elytra.

check_abilities.description: Determines if the condition should check if the entity can fly with an elytra.

enchantment.description: The namespace and ID of the enchantment of interest.

calculation.description: Which number to compare - either the sum of levels of this enchantment on all of the player's equipment, or the max level of this enchantment on any of the player's equipment.

comparison.description: How the enchantment level should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the enchantment level to.

group.description:
Entity group required for the entity to pass the check. One of default, undead, arthropod, illager and aquatic.
See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Mob#Classification for more information about entity groups.

entity_type.description: The namespace and ID of the entity type the entity needs to have to pass the check.

equipment_slot.description: Determines which equipment slot to check for the item. Accepts "mainhand", "offhand", "head", "chest", "legs", "feet".

item_condition.description: The item condition type to check for on the item in the specified equipment slot.

comparison.description:
How the fall distance should be compared to the specified value.
Note that the fall distance is 0 if the entity has the Slow Falling status effect.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the fall distance to.

fluid.description: The namespace and ID of the fluid tag of which the height should be checked. Most important examples: minecraft:water and minecraft:lava.

comparison.description: How the fluid height should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the fluid height should be compared to.

comparison.description: How the food level should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description:
Which value the food level should be compared to.
The food level is in the range of 0 to 20.
This entity condition type will only work on players.

gamemode.description: Name of the gamemode the player should have in order for this condition to evaluate to true.

comparison.description: How the health of the player should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the health should be compared to.

block_condition.description: The block condition type which blocks need to fulfill in order to count for this condition.

comparison.description: How the number of blocks which overlap and fulfill block_condition should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the number to.

block_condition.description: The block condition type to check for on the block that is overlapping with the entity's feet.

tag.description: The namespace and ID of the entity type tag the entity type needs to be in to pass the check.

nbt.description:
The NBT data to check for.
origins:nbt is only effective server-side. That means client-side power types such as origins:climbing, origins:entity_glow, origins:shader, etc. won't work with this.

block_condition.description: If specified, the condition will evaluate to true if the block underneath the entity's feet fulfills the specified block condition type. Otherwise, only check if the entity is on the ground.

origin.description:
The namespace and ID of the origin the player needs to have to pass the check.
Using this Entity Condition on a non-player Entity will most likely crash the game. To prevent that make sure to check if the entity is a player by using the Entity Type (Entity Condition Type) to prevent your game from crashing.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/entity_type/

layer.description: If specified, only evaluate the condition to true if the origin is from the specified origin layer.

bientity_condition.description: If specified, it will check for the entity/entities that fulfill the bi-entity condition.

comparison.description: How the number of entities that are currently riding the entity should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the number of entities currently riding the entity should be compared to.

power.description: The namespace and ID of the power which will be checked for being active. (meaning the entity has the power and the power has all conditions fulfilled)

The namespace and ID of the Power Type of a power the entity has.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/power_types/

The namespace and ID of the power the entity needs to have to pass the check.
Since only Living Entities can have powers, using this entity condition on a non-living entity might crash the game. Always make sure to check if the entity is a Living Entity by using the Living (Entity Condition Type) to prevent your game from crashing.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/living/

source.description: The namespace and ID of the source of the power.

predicate.description:
The namespace and ID of the predicate the entity needs to pass.
Note: This condition is only effective server-side. That means client-side power types such as origins:climbing, origins:entity_glow, origins:shader, etc. won't work with this.

distance.description: Determines the maximum distance the ray-cast will travel.

block.description: Determines whether the ray-cast should include blocks.

entity.description: Determines whether the ray-cast should include entities.

shape_type.description: Determines how the ray-cast will handle blocks.

fluid_handling.description: Determines how the ray-cast will handle fluids.

match_bientity_condition.description: If specified, the entity condition type will check if this bi-entity condition type is fulfilled by either or both the 'actor' (the entity being checked by the entity condition type) and 'target' (entity that the ray-cast has gone through). If not, the entity will be ignored.

hit_bientity_condition.description: If specified, the entity condition type will check if this bi-entity condition type is fulfilled by either or both the 'actor' (the entity being checked by the entity condition type) and 'target' (the entity that has hit by the ray-cast).

block_condition.description: If specified, the entity condition type will check if the block that was hit by the ray-cast fulfills this block condition type.

comparison.description: How the relative health of the player should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description:
Which value the relative health should be compared to.
relativeHealth = currentHealth / maxHealth

resource.description: The namespace and ID of a power that will be evaluated.

comparison.description: How the value of the power that will be evaluated should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the value of the power that will be evaluated to.

bientity_condition.description: If specified, it will only check for the entity/entities that fulfill the bi-entity condition.

comparison.description: How the amount of entities currently being ridden should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the amount of entities currently being ridden should be compared to.

bientity_condition.description: If specified, it will only check for the entity/entities that fulfill the bi-entity condition.

comparison.description: How the saturation level should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description:
The value the saturation level should be compared to.
Note that only players have a saturation level.

objective.description:
The name of the scoreboard objective to retrieve the value from and compare.
Due to the nature of scoreboards, this condition is only effective on the server-side.
If the entity does not have the scoreboard objective, this condition returns false; ingoring of the values of "comparison" and "compare_to".

comparison.description: How to compare the objective's value to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the objective's value to.

effect.description: The namespace and ID of the status effect to check for.

min_amplifier.description:
The minimum amplifier the status effect should have in order to pass the check.
Note: As 0 is the default strenght; effects like 'Speed II' have an amplifier (or bonus if you will) of 1.

max_amplifier.description:
The maximum amplifier the status effect should have in order to pass the check.
Note: As 0 is the default strenght; effects like 'Speed II' have an amplifier (or bonus if you will) of 1.

min_duration.description: The minimum duration in ticks the status effect should have left in order to pass the check.

max_duration.description: The maximum duration in ticks the status effect should have left in order to pass the check.

fluid.description: The namespace and ID of the fluid tag that should be checked. Most important examples: minecraft:water and minecraft:lava.

comparison.description: How the current day time ticks of the world should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description:
The value to compare the current day time ticks of the world to.
See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Daylight_cycle#24-hour_Minecraft_day for how this value coresponds to the ingame

item_condition.description: If specified, the condition will only evaluate to true if the item that is being used fulfills the specified item condition type.

comparison.description: How the experience level of the player should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the experience level should be compared to.

comparison.description: How the experience points of the player should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the experience points should be compared to.

fluid_condition.description:
Fluid Condition Types operate on a FluidState, essentially which fluid (if any) exists, as well as properties of the fluid. These are available to power/condition types that provides a fluid_condition object field.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/fluid_condition_types/

type.description:
ID and namespace of the fluid condition to evaluate.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/fluid_condition_types/

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description: All of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.

conditions.description: Any of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

tag.description: ID of the tag which the fluid should be in to pass the check.

item_condition.description:
Item Condition Types operate on an ItemStack. These are available to power/condition types that provides an item_condition object field.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/item_condition_types/

type.description:
ID and namespace of the item condition to evaluate.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/item_condition_types/

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description: All of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.

conditions.description: Any of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

comparison.description: Determines how to compare the number of items in this stack to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the item's count value to.

comparison.description: How to compare the item's armor value to the specified value.

compare_to.description:
Which value to compare the item's armor value to.
Non-armor items are considered as having an armor value of 0.
See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Helmet#Defense_points, https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Chestplate#Defense_points, https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Leggings#Defense_points and https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Boots#Defense_points

enchantment.description: ID of the enchantment of interest

comparison.description: How to compare the enchantment level the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the enchantment level against.

comparison.description: How to compare the item's harvest level to the specified value.

compare_to.description:
Which value to compare the item's harvest level to.
Refer to https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Tiers for the harvest level of the materials (there it's called "mining level").
Items without a material are considered to have a harvest level of 0.

ingredient.description: The ingredient this item must match to pass the check.

nbt.description: The NBT data to check for.

bientity_action.description:
Bi-entity Action Types operate on a Pair<Entity, Entity>; in simpler terms: an actor and a target. The actor and target is determined depending on the used power type, and can be swapped. These are available to power/action types that provides a bientity_action object field.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_action_types/

type.description:
ID and namespace of the bientity action to evaluate.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_action_types/

actions.description:
These actions will be executed one after the other (but in the same tick).
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/and/

action.description: The action which might be executed.

chance.description: The chance that the action will execute, from 0 to 1. (E.g. 0.1 means 10% chance, 0.95 means 95% chance).

fail_action.description: The action to execute if the specified action in the action field is not executed.

actions.description:
Executes one of the provided actions, choosing randomly based on the assigned weights. The actions with higher weight values are more likely to be chosen.
weight / sumOfAllWeights = chance

action.description: The action which will be executed after the delay.

ticks.description:
The amount of ticks until the action is executed.
Delaying an action for more than a few ticks is not recommended! This meta action type is not reliable for such task.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/delay/

actions.description:
Checks a list of actions associated with conditions, and executes the first one in the list for which the condition holds. Basically a less indentation-heavy way to represent a deeply nested If-Else (Meta Action Type).
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/if_else_list/

condition.description: A condition based on the type of action.

if_action.description: The action which is executed when the condition evaluates to true.

else_action.description: If present, this action will be executed when the condition evaluates to false.

action.description: The entity action type to execute on the actor entity.
The bi-entity action to execute which will have its 'target' and 'actor' contexts swapped.
The entity action type to execute on the target entity.

x.description: The amount of velocity to add on the x-axis.

y.description: The amount of velocity to add on the y-axis.

z.description: The amount of velocity to add on the z-axis.

client.description:
If this is false, the action will not execute on the client.
Used in cases where this action behaves unexpectedly. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_action_types/add_velocity/

server.description:
If this is false, the action will not execute on the server.
Used in cases where this action behaves unexpectedly. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_action_types/add_velocity/

set.description: If this is true, the action will act as a "set" velocity action, overriding the entity's current velocity instead of adding to it.

then.$comment: origins:nothing should be used instead if you want no change.

amount.description: The amount of damage to deal.

source.description: The damage source to be used. Controls e.g. the death message, invulnerabilities (e.g. towards fire), or whether armor is taken into account.

block_action.description: Block Actions operate an action on a selected block or set of blocks.

actions.description:
These actions will be executed one after the other (but in the same tick).
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/and/

action.description: The action which might be executed.

chance.description: The chance that the action will execute, from 0 to 1. (E.g. 0.1 means 10% chance, 0.95 means 95% chance).

fail_action.description: The action to execute if the specified action in the action field is not executed.

actions.description:
Executes one of the provided actions, choosing randomly based on the assigned weights. The actions with higher weight values are more likely to be chosen.
weight / sumOfAllWeights = chance

action.description: The action which will be executed after the delay.

ticks.description:
The amount of ticks until the action is executed.
Delaying an action for more than a few ticks is not recommended! This meta action type is not reliable for such task.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/delay/

actions.description:
Checks a list of actions associated with conditions, and executes the first one in the list for which the condition holds. Basically a less indentation-heavy way to represent a deeply nested If-Else (Meta Action Type).
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/if_else_list/

condition.description: A condition based on the type of action.

if_action.description: The action which is executed when the condition evaluates to true.

else_action.description: If present, this action will be executed when the condition evaluates to false.

action.description: The action to apply with the given offset.

x.description: How much to offset the position on the x-axis.

y.description: How much to offset the position on the y-axis.

z.description: How much to offset the position on the z-axis.

block.description: The namespace and ID of the block to place.

effects.description: Determines if the particle and other visual effects of the bonemeal-ing action should appear.

permission_level.description:
[Deprecated since 1.1.0]The permission level to use for the command. 0 is a "survival player", anything higher emulates some form of operator.
See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Server.properties#op-permission-level for details.

power.description: Determines the power of the explosion.

destruction_type.description: Determines the effect of the explosion on the terrain.

damage_self.description: Determines if the exploding block should be affected by the summoned explosion.

indestructible.description: If specified, the blocks that fulfills the specified block condition type is not destroyed by the summoned explosion.

destructible.description: If specified, the blocks that fulfills this specified block condition type are the only blocks that are destroyed by the summoned explosion.

create_fire.description: Determines if the explosion should create fire.

property.description:
The name of the property that will be modified.
See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Block_states#List_of_block_states for possible values.

operation.description: Determines how the value specified in the change field is operated on the specified property. Accepts "add" or "set".

change.description: If specified, the value to add, remove or set to/from the specified property if the specified property is an integer.

value.description: If specified, the boolean to use as the new value for the specified property if the specified property is a boolean.

enum.description: If specified, the string to use as the new value for the specified property if the specified property is a string.

cycle.description: If set to true, changes the property to the next state in the cycle, ignoring all other optional fields. All property types can use this operation.

entity_action.description: Entity Actions operate on an Entity. Some more specific actions only have an effect on more specific entity types (e.g. Exhaust (Action) only works on PlayerEntity, as other entities do not have a hunger bar).

actions.description:
These actions will be executed one after the other (but in the same tick).
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/and/

action.description: The action which might be executed.

chance.description: The chance that the action will execute, from 0 to 1. (E.g. 0.1 means 10% chance, 0.95 means 95% chance).

fail_action.description: The action to execute if the specified action in the action field is not executed.

actions.description:
Executes one of the provided actions, choosing randomly based on the assigned weights. The actions with higher weight values are more likely to be chosen.
weight / sumOfAllWeights = chance

action.description: The action which will be executed after the delay.

ticks.description:
The amount of ticks until the action is executed.
Delaying an action for more than a few ticks is not recommended! This meta action type is not reliable for such task.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/delay/

actions.description:
Checks a list of actions associated with conditions, and executes the first one in the list for which the condition holds. Basically a less indentation-heavy way to represent a deeply nested If-Else (Meta Action Type).
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/if_else_list/

condition.description: A condition based on the type of action.

if_action.description: The action which is executed when the condition evaluates to true.

else_action.description: If present, this action will be executed when the condition evaluates to false.

x.description: The amount of velocity to add on the x-axis.

y.description: The amount of velocity to add on the y-axis.

z.description: The amount of velocity to add on the z-axis.

space.description:
The Space to perform the velocity addition in.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/space/

client.description:
If this is false, the action will not execute on the client.
Used in cases where this action behaves unexpectedly. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_action_types/add_velocity/

server.description:
If this is false, the action will not execute on the server.
Used in cases where this action behaves unexpectedly. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_action_types/add_velocity/

set.description: If this is true, the action will act as a "set" velocity action, overriding the entity's current velocity instead of adding to it.

then.$comment: origins:nothing should be used instead if you want no change.

points.description: If set, this is the amount experience points that will be given to the player. Can not be negative.

levels.description: If set, this is the amount experience levels that will be given to the player. Can be negative and thus used to subtract levels.

effect.description: If set, this status effect will be applied by this action.

effects.description: If set, these status effects will be applied by this action.

radius.description: Determines the radius of the area.

bientity_action.description: If specified, this bi-entity action type may be executed on either or both the actor (the entity that has the power) and target (the entities within the specified radius).

bientity_condition.description: If specified, only execute the specified bi-entity action if this bi-entity condition type is fulfilled by either or both the 'actor' (the entity that has the power) or 'target' (the entities within the specified radius).

include_target.description: Determines whether the entity this action was executed on is included in the radius check.

block_action.description: The block action type to execute.

resource.description: The namespace and ID of the power that uses the Resource (Power Type) or has a built-in cooldown.

change.description: This value will be added to the resource (won't go below min or above max of the Resource (Power Type)).

operation.description: Determines if the action should add or set the value of the resource. Accepts "add" or "set".

effect.description: If specified, the status effect with this namespace and ID will be cleared. If not specified, all status effects will be cleared.

amount.description: The amount of damage to deal.

event.description: The namespace and ID of a game event. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Sculk_Sensor#Vibration_amplitudes for a list of game events you can use.

equipment_slot.description: Which equipped item to execute the action on. One of: "mainhand", "offhand", "head", "chest", "legs", "feet".

action.description: The item action type to execute on the item stack in the specified equipment slot.

command.description: The command to execute with the entity as the source (i.e. @s will select the entity itself).

permission_level.description: [Deprecated since 1.1.0]The permission level to use for the command. 0 is a "survival player", anything higher emulates some form of operator. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Server.properties#op-permission-level for details.

amount.description: The amount of exhaustion to apply to the player.

power.description: Determines the power of the explosion.

destruction_type.description: Determines the effect of the explosion on the terrain.

damage_self.description: Determines if the player should take damage from the summoned explosion.

indestructible.description: If specified, the blocks that fulfills the specified block condition type is not destroyed by the summoned explosion.

destructible.description: If specified, the blocks that fulfills this specified block condition type are the only blocks that are destroyed by the summoned explosion.

create_fire.description: Determines if the explosion should create fire.

food.description: The amount of food points to restore.

saturation.description: The amount of saturation points to restore.

value.description: The amount of breath to restore.

stack.description: The item stack to give to the entity.

item_action.description: If specified, the specified item action type will be executed on the item stack before it's given to the player.

preferred_slot.description: If specified, this will prioritize the action to put the item in the specified slot. Accepts "chest", "feet", "head", "legs", "mainhand" or "offhand".

power.description: The namespace and ID of the power to be granted/revoked to/from the entity.

source.description: The namespace and ID of the source of the power.

amount.description: The amount of health to restore.

action.description: If set, executes the specified action on the passenger entity.

bientity_action.description: If set, executes the specified action that can execute on both the passenger and the entity that's being ridden.

bientity_condition.description: If set, only execute the specified actions if the bi-entity condition is fulfilled.

recursive.description: If set to true, executes the specified actions on all the passenger entities, if there are more than one.

sound.description: The namespace and ID of the sound to play.

distance.description: Determines the maximum distance the ray-cast will travel.

block.description: Determines whether the ray-cast should include blocks.

entity.description: Determines whether the ray-cast should include entities.

shape_type.description: Determines how the ray-cast will handle blocks.

fluid_handling.description: Determines how the ray-cast will handle fluids.

bientity_condition.description: If specified, the specified bi-entity action type will only be executed if the specified bi-entity condition type is fulfilled by either or both the 'actor' (the entity that has the power) or 'target' (the entity that was hit by the ray-cast).

bientity_action.description: If specified, this bi-entity action type will be executed on either or both the 'actor' (the entity that has the power) or 'target' (the entity that was hit by the ray-cast).

block_action.description: If specified, this block action type will be executed on the block the ray-cast has hit.

before_action.description: If specified, execute this entity action type before casting a ray.

hit_action.description: If specified, execute this entity action on the entity that executed the ray-cast if the ray-cast has hit an entity/block.

miss_action.description: If specified, execute this entity action on the entity that executed the ray-cast if the ray-cast did not hit an entity/block.

command_at_hit.description: The command to execute upon the block/entity the ray-cast has hit.

command_hit_offset.description: Determines the offset of the command specified in the command_at_hit field.

command_along_ray.description: The command to execute for each step of the ray-cast.

command_step.description: Determines the size of the step of the ray-cast.

command_along_ray_only_on_hit.description: Determines if the command specified in the command_along_ray field should be executed only if the ray-cast has hit a block/entity.

action.description: If set, executes the specified action on the entity that's been ridden.

bientity_action.description: If set, executes the specified action that can execute on both the passenger and the entity that's being ridden.

bientity_condition.description: If set, only execute the specified actions if the bi-entity condition is fulfilled.

recursive.description: If set to true, executes the specified actions on all entities that are being ridden, if there are more than one.

duration.description: The amount of seconds the entity should burn.

radius_on_use.description: How much the radius should change when an effect is applied.

wait_time.description: How many ticks to wait until the cloud takes effect.

effect.description: If set, this status effect will be applied by the cloud to entities inside of it.

effects.description: If set, these status effects will be applied by the cloud to entities inside of it.

entity_type.description: The namespace and ID of the entity type that will be spawned.

tag.description: If specified, this NBT data will be applied to the entity that will be spawned.

entity_action.description: If specified, the specified entity action type will be executed on the entity that will be spawned when it is spawned.

particle.description: The particle type that will be spawned.

count.description: How much of the specified particle type will be spawned.

speed.description: Determines the speed of the specified particle type.

force.description: If set to true, the specified particle type that will be spawned can be seen from a far distance.

spread.description: Determines the size of the three-dimensional cuboid volume to spawn the specified particle type in.

offset_y.description: The offset of where the particle will be centered in the Y axis.

hand.description: Determines which hand is swung. Accepts either "MAIN_HAND", "OFF_HAND"

power.description: The namespace and ID of the power that uses the origins:toggle power type.
The namespace and ID of the power that will be triggered.

item_action.description: Item Actions operate on a stack of items.

actions.description:
These actions will be executed one after the other (but in the same tick).
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/and/

action.description: The action which might be executed.

chance.description: The chance that the action will execute, from 0 to 1. (E.g. 0.1 means 10% chance, 0.95 means 95% chance).

fail_action.description: The action to execute if the specified action in the action field is not executed.

actions.description:
Executes one of the provided actions, choosing randomly based on the assigned weights. The actions with higher weight values are more likely to be chosen.
weight / sumOfAllWeights = chance

action.description: The action which will be executed after the delay.

ticks.description:
The amount of ticks until the action is executed.
Delaying an action for more than a few ticks is not recommended! This meta action type is not reliable for such task.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/delay/

actions.description:
Checks a list of actions associated with conditions, and executes the first one in the list for which the condition holds. Basically a less indentation-heavy way to represent a deeply nested If-Else (Meta Action Type).
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_action_types/if_else_list/

condition.description: A condition based on the type of action.

if_action.description: The action which is executed when the condition evaluates to true.

else_action.description: If present, this action will be executed when the condition evaluates to false.

amount.description: The amount of items to remove.
The amount of damage it should do to the item stack.

ignore_unbreaking.description: Determines if this action should ignore the Unbreaking enchantment.

modifier.description: The ID of an item modifier.

origins_data_types.$comment: As Comparison and Modifier Operation are basicaly just enum's and badges are only used once they are not included in this list.

modifier.description: An Object used to specify how a value should be modified.

operation.description: The operation which will be performed by this modifier.

value.description: The value with which to apply the operation to the value.

name.description: A descriptive name for the modifier, describing where it comes from.

attributed_modifier.description:
An Object used to specify how a specific attribute should be modified.
Basically an Attribute Modifier with an additional attribute field.

attribute.description: ID of the attribute which will be modified by this modifier.

operation.description: The operation which will be performed by this modifier.

value.description: The value with which to apply the operation to the value.

name.description: A descriptive name for the modifier, describing where it comes from.

crafting_recipe.description: An Object specifying a shapeless or shaped crafting recipe. For some more information, See https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Recipe

type.description: The type of recipe. Either `minecraft:crafting_shaped` or `minecraft:crafting_shapeless`. Other recipe types are not supported.

id.description: An ID for this recipe. Has to be unique among all recipes, otherwise there will be a conflict.

result.description: The result of the crafting. Note that vanilla does not support NBT tags in the result.

ingredients.description: These items need to be put in the crafting grid for the recipe.

pattern.$comment: As some mods add crafting tables with larger than 3 by 3 grids I've not added a maxItems restiction
pattern.description: Specifies the pattern, with each element representing one row. Use a single character to describe one item. A space means that position is empty.

damage_source.description: The damage source to be used. Controls e.g. the death message, invulnerabilities (e.g. towards fire), or whether armor is taken into account.

name.description:
The name of the damage source.
Controls death message as well as other interactions.
Consider https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/damage_source_names/ when picking a name.

bypasses_armor.description: When true, armor values are not taken into account when calculating the actual damage amount taken.

fire.description: When true, the damage will be considered fire damage.

unblockable.description: When true, the damage will be unblockable (not reduced by resistance effects or protection enchantments).

magic.description: When true, the damage will be considered magic damage.

out_of_world.description: When true, the damage will be considered "out of world" damage, i.e. damage from falling into the void.

hud_render.description: An Object used to define how a resource or cooldown bar should be rendered.

should_render.description: Whether the bar should be visible or not.

sprite_location.description: The path to the file in the assets which contains what the bar looks like. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/sprites/ for a list of files included by default in the mod.

bar_index.description: The indexed position of the bar on the sprite to use. Please note that indexes start at 0.

condition.description: If set (and should_render is true), the bar will only display when the entity with the power fulfills this condition.

inverted.description: If set to true, inverts the way the hud render process (it'll look like its value is being decreased).

ingredient.description: Either: an Object specifying a registered item or item tag. Or: an Array of Objects specifying a registered item or item tag.

tag.description:
ID of an item tag.
Will be ignored if item is set.

ID of an item tag.
Will be ignored if item is set.

item_stack.description:
An Object which defines a new item stack.
See: https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/data_types/item_stack/

tag.$comment: Is there a better pattern for NBT data?

key.description: An Object which defines a keybinding, used in active powers to define which key they react to.

A string specifying the keybinding.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/keybindings/ for possible values.

continuous.description: Whether the keybinding should only trigger the power on the first tick the key is held down, or, if set to true, continuously on each tick while the key is held.

particle_effect.description: Either a String which defines the particle type or an Object which defines the particle type and its additional parameters.

type.description: The namespace and ID of the particle type.

params.description: The additional parameter for the particle type.

positioned_item_stack.description: An Object which defines a new item stack alongside a position in an inventory. Basically an Item Stack with a slot field.

tag.$comment: Is there a better pattern for NBT data?

slot.$comment: Because certian mods add inventory slots I've not specified a maximum
slot.description:
Inventory slot position of the stack.
If not specified, will be the first free slot in the inventory.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/extras/positioned_item_stack_slots/ for possible values

duration.description: Duration of the status effect in ticks.

is_ambient.description: Whether the effect counts as an ambient effect.

show_particles.description: Whether the status effect will spawn particles on the player.

show_icon.description: Whether the status effect will show an icon on the HUD.

vector.description:
An Object that specifies the X, Y and Z coordinates of a certain point in space.
See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/data_types/vector/

x.description: The X coordinate of the point.

y.description: The Y coordinate of the point.

z.description: The Z coordinate of the point.
